      • getListing

        private static DirectoryListing getListing(FSDirectory fsd,
                          INodesInPath iip,
                          String src,
                          byte[] startAfter,
                          boolean needLocation,
                          boolean isSuperUser)
                                    throws IOException
        Get a partial listing of the indicated directory We will stop when any of the following conditions is met: 1) this.lsLimit files have been added 2) needLocation is true AND enough files have been added such that at least this.lsLimit block locations are in the response
        Parameters:
        fsd - FSDirectory
        iip - the INodesInPath instance containing all the INodes along the path
        src - the directory name
        startAfter - the name to start listing after
        needLocation - if block locations are returned
        Returns:
        a partial listing starting after startAfter
        Throws:
        IOException

                           throws IOException
        Get the file info for a specific file.
        Parameters:
        fsd - FSDirectory
        src - The string representation of the path to the file
        isRawPath - true if a /.reserved/raw pathname was passed by the user
        includeStoragePolicy - whether to include storage policy
        Returns:
        object containing information regarding the file or null if file not found
        Throws:

      • getFileInfo4DotSnapshot

        private static HdfsFileStatus getFileInfo4DotSnapshot(FSDirectory fsd,
                                     String src)
                                               throws org.apache.hadoop.fs.UnresolvedLinkException
        Currently we only support "ls /xxx/.snapshot" which will return all the snapshots of a directory. The FSCommand Ls will first call getFileInfo to make sure the file/directory exists (before the real getListing call). Since we do not have a real INode for ".snapshot", we return an empty non-null HdfsFileStatus here.
        Throws:
        org.apache.hadoop.fs.UnresolvedLinkException

      • createFileStatus

        static HdfsFileStatus createFileStatus(FSDirectory fsd,
                              String fullPath,
                              byte[] path,
                              INode node,
                              boolean needLocation,
                              byte storagePolicy,
                              int snapshot,
                              boolean isRawPath,
                              INodesInPath iip)
                                throws IOException
        create an hdfs file status from an inode
        Parameters:
        fsd - FSDirectory
        path - the local name
        node - inode
        needLocation - if block locations need to be included or not
        isRawPath - true if this is being called on behalf of a path in /.reserved/raw
        Returns:
        a file status
        Throws:
        IOException - if any error occurs

      • getPermissionForFileStatus

        private static org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.FsPermission getPermissionForFileStatus(INodeAttributes node,
                                                                      boolean isEncrypted)
        Returns an inode's FsPermission for use in an outbound FileStatus. If the inode has an ACL or is for an encrypted file/dir, then this method will return an FsPermissionExtension.
        Parameters:
        node - INode to check
        snapshot - int snapshot ID
        isEncrypted - boolean true if the file/dir is encrypted
        Returns:
        FsPermission from inode, with ACL bit on if the inode has an ACL and encrypted bit on if it represents an encrypted file/dir.
